SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.boards

Class BoardFactory

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.boards.BoardFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
FourPlayersBoard, ThreePlayersBoard, TwoPlayersBoard
public abstract class BoardFactory extends Object implements Serializable
Class that represents the abstract concept of a Board, providing nearly all the methods for the boards, since only the bitmask is different among the three different boards
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • getBitMaskElement

      public boolean getBitMaskElement(int i, int j)
      Parameters:
      i - represents the line of the element sought
      j - represents the column of the element sought
      Returns:
      the boolean in the position (i,j) in the bitMask

    • getBoardMatrixElement

      public Item getBoardMatrixElement(int i, int j)
      Parameters:
      i - represents the line of the element sought
      j - represents the column of the element sought
      Returns:
      the Item in the position (i,j) in the boardMatrix

    • getBoardNumberOfRows

      public int getBoardNumberOfRows()
      Returns:
      the number of rows of the board, used to parameterize the code

    • getBoardNumberOfColumns

      public int getBoardNumberOfColumns()
      Returns:
      the number of columns of the board, used to parameterize the code

    • refillBoard

      public void refillBoard()
      Fills the board, placing items where the bitMask says it's a valid position but there is no Item at the moment

    • createBitMask

      public boolean[][] createBitMask()
      Starts the creation of the bitMask with the TwoPlayerBoard bitMask. The bitMask for three or four players starts from this one to add more valid positions to their bitmask
      Returns:
      TwoPlayerBoard's bitMask

    • pickItem

      public Item pickItem(int x, int y) throws NullItemPickedException, InvalidBoardPositionException
      Called during the procedure for executing a Player's move
      Parameters:
      x - represents the line of the element sought
      y - represents the column of the element sought
      Returns:
      the Item picked
      Throws:
      NullItemPickedException - if in the BoardMatrix the element is null
      InvalidBoardPositionException - if in the bitMask the element is null

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove(List<int[]> list)
      Server-side check for the validity of the move according to the game's rules
      Parameters:
      list - contains the positions of the Items a Player wants to pick
      Returns:
      true if the move is valid, false otherwise

    • hasFreeSide

      public boolean hasFreeSide(int i, int j)
      Used during checkMove to check if all the elements have a free side
      Parameters:
      i - represents the line of the element sought
      j - represents the column of the element sought
      Returns:
      true if the element in position i,j has at least one free sides, false otherwise

    • itemHasAllFreeSide

      public boolean itemHasAllFreeSide(int i, int j)
      Used to check whether a position on the board, containing an item, has all free slots around it
      Parameters:
      i - represents the line of the element sought
      j - represents the column of the element sought
      Returns:
      true if the Item in position i,j has all free sides, false otherwise

    • checkInLine

      public boolean checkInLine(List<int[]> list)
      Used during CheckMove to make sure that all picked element are in a straight line
      Parameters:
      list - contains the positions of the Items a Player wants to pick
      Returns:
      true if all the items are in a straight line, false otherwise

    • setBoardMatrixElement

      public void setBoardMatrixElement(Item item, int i, int j)
      Used for testing purposes to simulate different borderline scenarios
      Parameters:
      item - the Item we want to be set
      i - represents the line where we want to set the Item
      j - represents the column where we want to set the Item

    • getBoardMatrix

      public Item[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Used for backup and testing purposes
      Returns:
      the boardMatrix of the Board

    • getBitMask

      public boolean[][] getBitMask()
      Used for backup and testing purposes
      Returns:
      the bitMask of the Board

    • setBoardMatrix

      public void setBoardMatrix(Item[][] boardMatrix)
      Used for backup and testing purposes
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - , the specific boardMatrix to be set in the Board

    • setBitMask

      public void setBitMask(boolean[][] bitMask)
      Used for backup and testing purposes
      Parameters:
      bitMask - , the specific bitMask to be set in the Board
